channel.title: Error in runserver
channel.description: I have this error that randomly my compiler will say Error: Unable to start on port 43594, and its the only compiler up. It does that when I run my server then I have to restart it because poeple can't log on...why is it doing this?

item.title: Error in runserver
item.dc:creator: @Amerks5 Amerks5
item.description:
@Amerks5 wrote:

Oh, I see. That explained it better. So from what I understand, if I had a default port, I think like 5555? They might be able to hack the computer? Er, say that port was like a port that is important on your computer, THEN they could hack it? Anyways, you explained ALOT better. Thank you!

Read full topic

item.title: Error in runserver
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch Java Is My Bitch™
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch wrote:

Router’s are ultimate protection according to my dog.

You could get hacked, but a more likely scenario is server wise, not computer wise. Since a server has a lot of bugs, you can exploit them, but then it would lead to hacking your server not the actual computer.

Like I’ve seen a person who got Admin, not due to their name of anything like that, just a pure hack, hacked the shit out of that server.

I’ve never seen someone go to the extent of actual harming your computer, and through a port like 43594. So i find it quite difficult for anyone lurking in your server, but you never know.

Read full topic

item.title: Error in runserver
item.dc:creator: @Amerks5 Amerks5
item.description:
@Amerks5 wrote:

So someone can hack my computer if I host my server? Its not very likely is it? and my Firewall could block them? lol

Read full topic

item.title: Error in runserver
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

Amerks5:

Thanks Java Is My Bitch And I have another question, can someone hack my computer if I host my server? Sorry Im just wondering

No. It technically is possible, but someone with that amount of knowledge wouldn’t bother hacking your computer.

item.title: Error in runserver
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch Java Is My Bitch™
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch wrote:

Butnuget, there called processes, open up task manager, and kill the process called java.exe not javaw.exe(If your using moparscapes).

Read full topic

item.title: Error in runserver
item.dc:creator: @butnugget butnugget
item.description:
@butnugget wrote:

if your run server window is up it will do that 2. if u have no window up 2 start your server and u still get that error press ctrl+alt+delete (at the same time) 2 see if a window is up if… it is hidden. yw for your help.

Read full topic
